nodes.text: if the carriers are not built and properly equipped a shadow will fall over the whole of Britain's defence capability. It will not only be the Royal Navy that will be threatened with descent into decline. It will be the Army and the Royal Air Force as well.
Britain's military standing with America currently so high will suffer unless it can maintain some sort of equivalence with the American military machine now so preponderant.

If Britain's military standing with America will suffer unless it can maintain some sort of equivalence with the American military machine then - if Britain does not build and properly equip the new carriers a shadow will fall over its defence cabability
If the Pentagon is already qualifying its admiration of British combat skills it is likely to be less complimentary if Britain falls technically further behind
The Pentagon while expressing its appreciation of British combat skills already qualifies its admiration. The British forces it says compensate for technical deficiencies by human achievement.

Britain is at present enjoying an artificial military superiority over its European partners. The bigger EU states - France Italy Spain and now Germany - are professionalising their armed forces. They are also bracing themselves to accept higher levels of defence spending.
If the bigger EU states are professionalising their armed forces then - if Britain does not build and properly equip the new carriers a shadow will fall over its defence cababilities
the Services' ability to mount independent operations will be compromised.
If the Services' ability to mount independent operations will be compromised then - if Britain does not build and properly equip the new carriers a shadow will fall over its defence cabability
The Navy's ability to mount independent operations will be compromised

If the Army and the Royal Air Force will not be able to undertake missions at a distance and the Navy's ability to mount independent operations will be compromised the Services' ability to mount independent operations will be compromised
The Army will not be able to undertake missions at a distance from the home base
The same goes for the Royal Air Force
The Army cannot undertake missions at a distance without aircover essential to its operability
it will not have the air cover essential to its operability
It cannot acquire land bases from which to operate outside the home area unless the Navy can provide cover while it does so
If the Navy cannot offer the Air Force appropriate aircover at a distance it cannot undertake missions at a distane
